Disable optimization for more regular monitoring.
No trace at the moment.\nImports a GPX file via the menu.
Adjusts the frequency/distance of GPS points according to the movement (ACTIVE / SLOW / IDLE).
Adjusts the frequency/distance of GPS points according to the movement (ACTIVE / SLOW / IDLE).
Segnaletica: impara i simboli locali e segui il percorso segnato.

Before leaving: • Consult a local newsletter + evolution hour by hour (wind, rain, thunderstorms). • Look also: temperature felt in altitude, gusts on peaks, limit rain/snow (if season). • Plan B: shorter/lower route + loops (fast return).
Thunderstorms (simple rules): • Avoid ridges, peaks, edges, clear areas when risk increases. • Remove metal objects (sticks, fences) and move away from isolated trees. • Flash-to-bang: < 30 s between lightning and thunder • Safety position: squat on bag/insulating, feet joints, hands on knees; avoids stretching. • As a group: spread out (10 m) to limit the risk of collective impact. • Wait 30 minutes after the last thunder before you leave.
Other weather traps: • Strong wind: caution on edges/coles (disequilibrium), move away from the edges. • Heavy rain: attention to flash floods (valley bottoms, ravines) + slides. • Fog: slows down, stays grouped, pointing forward (sign, crossing, secondary top).
Orientamento: usa mappa e bussola; tieni traccia della tua posizione.
Rispetto della natura: resta sui sentieri, riporta a casa i rifiuti e rispetta la fauna.
Primo soccorso: porta un kit di base e sappi usarlo.

Respect in National Reserves and Parks • Parks: protected areas. Frequent rules: stay on the trails, do not pick anything, no fire, dogs prohibited (even on a leash), drones prohibited unless authorized. Respect on-site signs and local orders. • Nature reserves & regional parks: variable rules (bivouac, dogs, fires). Check for seasonal quietness areas and signage.
Why not bathe in high-altitude lakes • Fragile ecosystems: many lakes are oligotrophic and very sensitive; small disturbances have great effects. • Pollutants: sunscreen/body products, textile fibres and micro-organisms degrade water and plankton; focus on managed bathing areas. • Wildlife disturbance: amphibians and shorebirds are sensitive to noise, trampling and clapp (plants, spawning grounds). • Health/safety: very cold water (thermal shock/hypothermia), slippery banks; Some municipalities prohibit bathing by decree. • Simple rule: if a ban is displayed, you do not bathe; Otherwise, observe without entering the water, leave nothing, avoid prolonged contact.
Good practices in protected areas • Stay on the trails to limit erosion. • Bivouac: often tolerated overnight (after 7pm – before 9am), away from roads/houses; remain > 20 m from lakes/water courses; leave with grey water and waste. • Dogs: usually forbidden in park hearts; keep on a leash and respect periods of tranquillity. • Drones: assimilated to motorized and prohibited aircraft in park cores (rare exceptions on authorization). • Wildlife & herds: do not continue; make a wide detour; Close the fences.
Marking: color codes - GR: white/red; // = straight; angle = turn; Cross = wrong path. GRP: yellow/red; territory loops. PR: yellow; local/day loops.
• Check the local weather before you leave. • Avoid ridges, peaks, edges and clear areas if risk increases. • Identify areas of retreat in advance (cabana, building, dense forest not isolated). .
Durante un temporale: allontanati da creste, alberi isolati e punti alti. Scendi in una zona riparata.
• Wait for the confirmed distance (≥30 min without thunder). • Checks the condition of the unit, warms/drys if necessary. • In case of accident, alert 112 and precise position, condition, access. .

• Leave early/late, avoid the hottest hours. • Wood small to small (0.5–1 L/h depending on effort), dirty a little food. • Cover yourself: hat/chap, glasses, sunscreen, light sleeves. • Weighs naked/forearm if possible, multiplies breaks in shade. • Warning signs: headache, nausea, cramps, dizziness, confusion — STOP, get shaded, refresh yourself, rehydrate yourself, warn if it persists. .

• Superimposed 3 layers (breathing / insulating / rainproof). • Warm head/hand/foot guard; changes a wet garment as soon as possible. • Cut the wind, shelter; move regularly without sweating excessively. • Drink and eat (hot if possible) to keep energy. • Warning signs: uncontrolled chills, awkwardness, drowsiness — warms gently, isolates soil/wind, alerts if worsening. .
Navigazione: prepara la traccia, controlla cartina e bussola, usa il GPS con prudenza e avvisa un contatto del percorso.
Fauna selvatica: mantieni le distanze, resta calmo e non dare cibo agli animali.
This action will delete the device memory file.
No application available to open this file.
Mantieni lo schermo acceso mentre usi la mappa
No application to display this image.
What do you want to do?
Start a recording to set a starting point.
The arrow points to the first recorded point (departure)._TOK0__The distance and heading automatically update.
Guide to the starting point with heading and distance.
Emergency information and call options or SMS.
Simple rules to minimize impact in hiking.
Essential gestures to keep in mind in case of incident.
This action erases the displayed trace.
Tap the weather map to quickly find reflexes by situation. These tips do not replace a reliable newsletter or common sense in the field.
Rischio di temporali: cerca riparo ed evita le zone esposte.
• Beware of ridges and corridors; avoid exposed lakes and bridges._TOK0__ • Anticipe unstable branches/rocks; space the group. • Fixed hood/equipment; lowers the center of gravity in the gusts. .
• Hydrate early and often; useful salts/sweet water. • Slow down, multiplies breaks in shadow; cover neck/head. • Monitor cramps, headaches, confusion, stop & cool. .
• Overlays layers; protects ends and wind._TOK0_ • Dry storage: changes a wet top; Isolate yourself from the ground. • Hypo: chills, awkwardness, slowness, warm sweetness, wet change. .

• Reduce the appearance; remains grouped; visibility / cliff = prudence ++._TOK0__ • Orient yourself: compass, short azimuth, simple attack points. • Mark the path (waypoints), often check map/terrain. .
• Avoids ravine bottoms in case of thunderstorm; flash raw attention._TOK0__ • Keep a breathable layer; protects what should not be wet. • Feet: anticipated slide (stone/wood) and prolonged cold. .
Mountain thunderstorm = immediate danger (fouling, hail, gusts, flash floods). Anticipate and adapt the route. .

• Check the weather report before leaving (possible thunderstorm = short/evasive route). • In the field, watch the sky: rapid budding, distant thunder, rotating wind, sizzling. • Evacuate ridges, ridges, peaks, exposed slabs; target a low but dry area, away from an isolated point._TOK0__ • Step away from each other by at least 20 m to limit the group risk. • As a last resort, squat on dry bag/cord (insulating), tight feet, minimum exposure time. .

• Do not stay under an isolated tree, a metallic overhang, a top cross, an electric line. • Do not use sticks/pilets held in the air; store antennas, masts, umbrellas. • Do not shelter the entire group in the same place; avoid running caves and banks in flood. .
After the storm: prudence on wet snows/rocks, weakened snow bridges, flooded flows/locals. .

• Early departure, adapted rhythm, frequent breaks in the shade. • Drink before thirst, electrolytes if prolonged effort; hat + glasses category 3/4, cream SPF 50.\n • Monitor headache, nausea, confusion: immediate cessation/refreshment; alert so worsening. .

• Overlay of layers (breathing/insulating/winding), hand/foot/head protections. • Moulded = danger: prefer dry clothes; watch chills, malfeasance, drowsiness.\n • Sweet hot drink, soil isolation (cover), shelter from the wind; Emergency alert if altered. .
• Beware of gusts in ridges/coles, unstable cornices. • Short-set poles, safe support points, dust glasses. • Renunciate if uncertain progression: turn back = right decision. .

Safety tips in nature:_TOK0__ • Notify a relative of your itinerary and an hour of return. • Checks the weather and any warnings. • Brings water, food, hot layer, emergency kit, survival blanket._TOK0__ • Offline card / topo + charged phone (energy saving mode).\n • Keep the margin (day, weather, shape) and know how to turn around. • In season of hunting or fishing: remains visible (living colors) and follow local signs. .

Respect for nature and others :_TOK0__ • Stay on the trails, close fences, dogs kept on leash if necessary._TOK0__ • Take all your waste (even biodegradable) and avoid fire in times of risk. • Be discreet near homes, herds and sensitive areas (nested, reserves). • Fishermen: learn about minimum periods, permits and sizes; respect banks and other users.\n • Mushroom pickers: identifies with certainty, cuts with a knife without tearing the mycelium, uses an airy basket and collects only the necessary. .

Quick checklist before leaving :_TOK0__ • Itinerary + off-line track OK? Weather checked? Close informed ?\n • Water (≥ 1.5 L), snacks, windbreak/polar, emergency kit, survival cover. • Headlight, phone charge, map / GPS; useful whistle._TOK0__ • Depending on the season: sun/rain/cold protection, repellent. • On-site: regular rhythm, breaks, turn back if doubted.\n • Emergency: 112 (or SMS 114). Gives the place as precise as possible. .
